responses.rationale: Factual report of detection and likely threat without explicit alarmist or reassuring cues.
Factual description of symptoms attributed to a source, without added alarmist framing.
Factual statement about potential contact risk without explicit framing.
Factual statement about a factor contributing to spread without explicit framing.
A question, contains no explicit framing cues.
Factual comparison of geographic spread without amplified language about impact.
Factual report of countries halting imports in response to an outbreak (standard term).
Factual description of virus strain and history without explicit framing.
Factual description of symptoms and impacts presented neutrally.
'particularly hard hit' is moderate; 'disasters being declared' is factual report of classification.
'raised concerns' is a psychological verb, neutral per context guard without amplification.
A question, contains no explicit framing cues.
Factual assessment of the issue's nature ('primarily an animal health issue') without explicit reassurance.
'not impossible' is bare negation; 'pretty rare' is factual assessment of frequency.
Factual report of authorities' belief and evidence without explicit framing.
Factual report of detection locations and flock types attributed to a source.
Factual report of detection location following others without explicit framing.
Factual report of detection location and flock type attributed to an agency.
'highly pathogenic' is a technical term; factual report of detection location and type.
Factual report of detection location and flock type without explicit framing.
Factual report about a company not disclosing information without explicit framing.
Factual report of detection location, flock type, and number attributed to USDA.
'high mortality rates' is a factual characteristic presented neutrally.
'reigniting fears' is a psychological verb, neutral per context guard without amplification.
Factual historical report about emergence and spread ('large outbreaks' is scale, not amplified impact).
Factual report of a company confirmation without explicit framing.
'arguably more humane' is an opinion/assessment, not explicit reassurance about safety.
Factual report of confirmation location and flock type without explicit framing.
'concerning' is qualified ('non-health-related reasons') and not amplified.
Factual report of a news report about a rare case without explicit framing.
Factual description of illness range ('mild to severe') without explicit framing.
Factual description of transmission method without explicit framing.
Factual description of transmission methods attributed to a source.
Factual description of transmission method without explicit framing.
'rare' is a factual assessment of frequency attributed to a source.
Factual historical report about an outbreak and its impact on production.
Factual report of detection location and type attributed to USDA; HPAI is technical.
Factual report of a company confirmation and location; HPAI is technical.
Factual list of cases/locations without explicit framing.
Factual report about export growth and downturn ('downturn' is factual description).
Factual report about a company not disclosing information without explicit framing.
Factual description of spread method and timing without explicit framing.
Factual report of confirmation dates, locations, and types; 'hit with' is neutral.
Factual report of confirmation date, location, type, and significance; 'hit with' is neutral.
'new fear is driven by' is a psychological noun, neutral per context guard without amplification.
Factual report about government not reporting information without explicit framing.
Factual report of other regions 'dealing with' (neutral term) avian flu.
Factual report about circulation history and locations without explicit framing.
Factual report about the strain and its relation to a previous one.
Factual report about market situation ('hitting the market' is neutral) and conditions.
Factual report of detection date, location, and flock type.
Factual report of detection date, locations, and flock types attributed to agency.
Factual report about outbreaks 'hitting the country' (neutral term) and conditions.
Factual report of a country banning/limiting imports following an outbreak (standard term).
Factual report of buyers limiting purchases due to an outbreak (standard term).
Factual report of infections triggering restrictions and a country blocking products.
Factual report of latest cases, locations, and flock types.
Factual historical report about emergence and spread ('large outbreaks' is scale, not amplified impact).
Factual report about market situation ('hitting the market' is neutral) and conditions.
Factual report about spread method and evidence without explicit framing.
Factual statement about human infection frequency ('rare') and condition ('close contact').
